Text: Kebira Crater (Arabic: فوهة كبيرة‎ ‎ ) is the name given to a circular topographic feature that was identified in 2007 by Farouk El-Baz and Eman Ghoneim using satellite imagery, Radarsat-1, and Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) data in the Sahara desert.

Text: Kebira Crater:  This feature straddles the border between Egypt and Libya.

2:

Text: Kebira Crater:  The name of this feature is derived from the Arabic word for "large", and also from its location near the Gilf Kebir ("Great Barrier") region in southwest Egypt.
